Ini Dua Biang Kerok yang Bikin Gas Industri RI Mahal
04 Nov 2019, 04:39 by Trio Hamdani


Foto: Danang Sugianto

Jakarta - Pengamat energi dari Universitas Gadjah Mada (UGM) Fahmi Radhi menilai ada dua penyebab harga gas industri di Indonesia mahal. Mahalnya harga gas industri sampai membuat Presiden Joko Widodo (Jokowi) turun tangan."Nah kalau itu masih dianggap mahal ya saya lihat ada dua penyebab ya, yang pertama harga itu kan ditentukan dari harga gas di hulu. Nah kemudian yang kedua itu ditentukan dengan biaya pengelolaan infrastruktur dan margin," kata dia saat dihubungi detikcom, Jakarta, Senin (4/11/2019).Menurut dia harga gas industri di hulu memang masih relatif mahal, yaitu antara US$ 6 hingga US$ 8 per MMBTU. Sementara di Malaysia hanya US$ 4,5-6. "Misalnya di sumur Jawa Barat ya, itu sekitar US$ 6,75, tapi sumur di Medan itu US$ 8,49. Nah ini memang beragam harganya tergantung lokasinya," sebutnya.Faktor kedua yang mempengaruhi harga gas industri adalah ketersediaan pipa. Itu karena distribusinya harus melalui pipa. Sedangkan ketersediaan pipa di Indonesia masih kurang memadai.Dia menyebut Indonesia yang sangat luas dengan sumber gas terpencar di beberapa daerah membutuhkan sekitar 18.500 km pipa gas. Sedangkan pipa yang ada, misalnya yang dioperasikan oleh PGN baru sekitar 9.300an km."Nah ini menjadi penyebab juga mengapa harganya dikategorikan mahal tadi itu ya," tambahnya.Simak Video "Blak-blakan Surya Tjandra: Bela Buruh dan Konflik Agraria"[Gambas:Video 20detik](toy/fdl)

These are the two culprit that make RI's Industrial Gas Expensive
Nov 04 2019, 04:39 by Trio Hamdani


Photo: Danang Sugianto

Jakarta - Energy observer from Gadjah Mada University (UGM) Fahmi Radhi believes that there are two causes of high industrial gas prices in Indonesia. The high price of industrial gas makes President Joko Widodo (Jokowi) intervene. "Well, if it is still considered expensive, I see there are two reasons, first the price is determined from the upstream gas price. So then the second is determined by cost infrastructure and margin management, "he said when contacted by AFP, Jakarta, Monday (11/04/2019). According to him the price of upstream industrial gas is still relatively expensive, between US $ 6 to US $ 8 per MMBTU. While in Malaysia only US $ 4.5-6. "For example in the West Java well, yes, it was around US $ 6.75, but the well in Medan was US $ 8.49. This indeed varies in price depending on location," he said. The second factor affecting the price of industrial gas is the availability of pipelines. That's because the distribution must go through a pipe. While the availability of pipelines in Indonesia is still inadequate. He said that Indonesia, which is very extensive with gas sources scattered in several areas, requires around 18,500 km of gas pipes. While the existing pipelines, for example, operated by PGN, are only about 9,300 km. "Well, this is also the reason why the price is categorized as expensive," he added. : 20sec video] (toy / fdl)
